keyword: how many calories in a cheese and ham sandwich
title: How Many Calories in a Cheese and Ham Sandwich?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a cheese and ham sandwich, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, carbs, fat, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Cheese and Ham Sandwich?
assumptions: 2 slices white bread; 50g sliced ham; 30g cheddar cheese; assembled cold, no mayo, butter, or condiments added.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, meat/cheese brands, portion sizes, and added spreads or veggies. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard cheese and ham sandwich has about 450 kcal and 25 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white
Add a slice of tomato and lettuce

faqs.q: How many calories in a cheese and ham sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 450 kcal for a standard version with white bread, ham, and cheese.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a cheese and ham sandwich?
faqs.a: About 25 g protein, mainly from the ham and cheese.

faqs.q: Does adding mayo increase calories much?
faqs.a: Yes, 1 tbsp adds ~90 kcal, making the total around 540 kcal.

faqs.q: How does bread type affect calories?
faqs.a: Whole wheat may reduce calories by ~20 kcal compared to white bread due to lower density.

faqs.q: Is sodium high in a cheese and ham sandwich?
faqs.a: Yes, around 1200 mg, mostly from processed ham and cheeseâ€”opt for low-sodium options if needed.
